Comment: What "MAGA like tendencies"?? Fascism? no? anti-democracy or anti-elections? No? Bernie is \*\*\*definitely\*\*\* not to blame for years or decades of democratic leadership dysfunction. He appealed to his base using popular policy and populist rhetoric. He absolutely encouraged voting, and the minority of progressives who abstained because of an "impossibly high standard" were not the reason Harris lost. Stop spreading this ridiculous narrative that Bernie or progressives being critical of democratic leadership caving into conservative narratives and prioritizing some vague idea of "fairness" over actual policy is the reason people are deciding to abstain (a decision I absolutely do \*\*\*NOT\*\*\* support by the way. Anyone abstaining essentially voted for trump, but progressive apathy isn't the reason Trump won, nor was it caused by the progressive base or Bernie).  What "MAGA tier conspiracy theories" did Bernie spend his "entire career spreading"? His opposition to the iraq war? Support for gay soldiers and marriage decades before it was acceptable? His support of progressive healthcare policy, free education, infrastructure, all massively supported by democrats and americans in general? Get this disinformation out of here.

Comment: I have a decades’ old psych degree from a decent state university that I vaguely use in my work but it’s not direct by ANY means, it’s not required. I, someone who is just a regular person, have better political predictive abilities than these fucking yuppies who have fancy degrees in them.   When Trump won the nomination in 2016, I knew we’d lose. I turned to my partner and said, “Trump is gonna win.” Because the DNC, in all their genius, thought they could overnight become marketing gurus capable of battling 30 years of hateful propaganda fed directly into the moronic brains of the average American about Clinton.   It’s pathetic that I knew better than these paid assholes.   When Kamala was pushed forward, I cringed - here we go again (for different reasons), but even my black friends were dubious as shit because we remember the vitriol that came out about her the last time she ran. America is too sexist and too racist in the gerrymandered nonsense we have to ever elect a woman in my lifetime.   I’ve been wrong ONCE politically on who would win or lose a National election and that was Obama. I voted for him confident in my vote but that he’d also lose. I was very shocked he won. And further shocked he wasn’t assassinated on the spot.   Don’t get me wrong, I voted for Hillary knowing she’d lose. But I was beyond confident she’d lose. I pissed off so many of my neo liberal friends explaining to them why but none of them gave me a “you were right” afterwards lol.   The right is correct about hardcore “liberals” living in an echo chamber bubble - my friends who refused the reality of what was coming all lived in blue havens (Seattle, major cities in Cali, Boston). They didn’t have the exposure to right wing media to know wtf we were up against.  And here the fuck we are today. A decade later. With the same morons at the helm. We’re beyond fucked long term.
Author: buggybugoot
